00040 #ifndef PHYSWORLDCALLBACKMANAGER_CPP
00041 #define PHYSWORLDCALLBACKMANAGER_CPP
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //Ogre Frame rendering callbacks are implemented here
00044 //
00045 //Since Ogre handles the main loop, most of our interactions for the game logic
00046 //need to interact with this, and the most consistent interface is the ogre
00047 //frame listener, so we created this wrapper around that.
00048 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00049 
00050 //Includes
00051 #include "physworldcallbackmanager.h"
00052 #include "physdatatypes.h"
00053 #include "physworld.h"
00054 
00055 using namespace std;
00056 
00057 
00058 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00059 // PhysWorldFrameListener
00060 ///////////////////////////////////////
00061 PhysWorldCallBackManager::PhysWorldCallBackManager(PhysWorld* _Parent): PreInputCallback(NULL)
00062 {
00063         TheWorldIListenTo = _Parent;
00064 
00065         PreInputCallback = NULL;
00066         PostInputCallback = NULL;
00067 
00068         PrePhysicsCallback = NULL;
00069         PostPhysicsCallback = NULL;
00070 
00071         PreRenderCallback = NULL;
00072         PostRenderCallback = NULL;
00073 }
00074 
00075 PhysWorldCallBackManager::~PhysWorldCallBackManager()
00076 {
00077 
00078 }
00079 
00080 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00081 //Preinput callback will be called in the main loop first
00082 ///////////////////////////////////////
00083 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::PreInput()
00084 {
00085         //If a call back has been set then we use it, otherwise we can
00086         //assume that we should just keep execute the main loop
00087         if(NULL!=PreInputCallback)
00088         {
00089                 return (*PreInputCallback)();
00090         }
00091         return true;
00092 }
00093 
00094 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::ErasePreInput()
00095 {
00096         this->PreInputCallback = NULL;
00097 }
00098 
00099 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::SetPreInput(bool (*Callback)())
00100 {
00101         this->PreInputCallback = Callback;
00102 }
00103 
00104 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::IsPreInputCallbackSet()
00105 {
00106         if(NULL==PreInputCallback)
00107         {
00108                 return false;
00109         }
00110         return true;
00111 }
00112 
00113 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00114 //Postinput callback will be called in the main loop right after input
00115 ///////////////////////////////////////
00116 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::PostInput()
00117 {
00118         //If a call back has been set then we use it, otherwise we can
00119         //assume that we should just keep execute the main loop
00120         if(NULL!=PostInputCallback)
00121         {
00122                 return (*PostInputCallback)();
00123         }
00124         return true;
00125 }
00126 
00127 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::ErasePostInput()
00128 {
00129         this->PostInputCallback = NULL;
00130 }
00131 
00132 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::SetPostInput(bool (*Callback)())
00133 {
00134         this->PostInputCallback = Callback;
00135 }
00136 
00137 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::IsPostInputCallbackSet()
00138 {
00139         if(NULL==PostInputCallback)
00140         {
00141                 return false;
00142         }
00143         return true;
00144 }
00145
